title: Transas in Grand Corsica VTS Plan
text:
The Port of Ajaccio, the main commercial port in the south of Corsica in the Mediterranean, is now equipped with the latest generation Vessel Traffic Surveillance system from Transas. This project was implemented in partnership between the territorial and state authorities of Corsica.
The system delivered by Transas allows for surveillance of the Ajaccio Bay and Ricanto area, as well as for control of the access channel.
It will also reduce collision risks, protect the environment, help to optimise the use of port resources and improve the quality of the services offered.
To read more about Transas Marine in our Supplier Directory, click here 
Within the project Transas delivered and installed its Navi-Monitor surveillance solution to monitor and manage the vessel traffic within the port in real-time mode.
The harbour masterâ€™s office represents the heart of the system. The operator display units installed ensure the operational marine traffic picture is available in real-time and is based on the accurate data transmitted from several high-performant sensors including radar, antennas and VHF radio, AIS base station and weather station.
This allows port officers to fulfill their daily tasks and responsibilities related to maritime safety and security in accordance with the State Transportation Code.
The VTS system installation is a part of a wider modernisation plan aimed at improving overall port capacity and increasing safe navigation in its operational areas.
Fact File: Transas is a world-leading provider of high tech equipment, software applications, integrated solutions and services for the maritime industry: Transas has over 35% of the ECDIS world market share, around 25% of VTMS installations and over 45% of the maritime simulation market.
